intro: Gayophytum gracile, commonly known as the slender gayophytum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Gayophytum gracile is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
